intro: Scleria roxburghii var. australiensis, commonly known as the Australian flat sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wet or damp environments, such as swampy areas and riverbanks. It has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower spikes. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
